title: interview 1
blurb: I thought they were my friends...but when I joined the conversation, they stunned me into silence with their outrageous and hurtful statements.

title: interview 2
blurb: I was coaching my girls’ basketball team when two young men in suits busted into the gym, grabbed the ball from one of the girl’s hands and took over the court.  I had to act quickly, effectively, and responsibly, but when they referred to me as a “N….,” I nearly lost my cool.

title: interview 3
blurb: All mothers want to protect their children from harm, but as a Black mother in a White dominant society, protection against deliberate racist behavior is at the top of the list…

title: interview 4
blurb: Nothing in my life as a White woman had prepared me for what it actually felt like to be the object of racism…
